Ratings.comment: Took intro to equine studies last semester. Not only does Cole have a clique, she doesnt even try to hide it. Pretty sad, acting like 20 something year old girls are her besties. Her TA is a mini dr cole, too. Off-putting.

I can't stand her.  she singled me out from the start bc I was sick for 2 classes and couldn't get a note.   she had a 'holier than thou' attitude that pissed many people off. would not make someone suffer her
She's a solid professor. If you put in the effort, you will be fine.
Not only does Cole play favorites, her semi of a TA does too.

Says attendance isn't required. Takes points off for not attending. Lies to your face. Most rude person I have ever met in my life. She has like two "buddies" that works at her farm in class and those are the only ppl she will ever talk to/care about. everyone else is treated as garbage. Lies about grades and expectations. Very passive aggressive

Hands down the worst professor I've ever taken at Ohio State. She doesn't care about her students, says one thing and does another, and asks about concepts that haven't even been reviewed, expecting everyone to know the answers. Her tests are tough and she takes off points for silly things. Would not recommend this professor to anyone
Great Professor!!!!

what can I say, Kim has literally no education on horses (I think her phd was on chickens) and boy does it show. she'll be disrespectful right to your face and doesn't get along with others. passive aggressive as heck!

Dr. Cole came off as disrespectful in every way possible. She would have 2 or 3 close "friends" she'd talk to in class and ignore everybody else. She would make you come to events on weekends, school holidays, and work at her horse barn for credit (unpaid). She comes off as rude and will never respond to your emails. She rarely responds in person.

Dr Cole is not a professor I would willingly take again. This course is graded based on a few different fun group assignments, however, when they are all practically worth 10 points each compared to the 3 difficult 100-point exams that are graded for extremely specific answers, the class becomes very stressful very fast with no help received by her

Dr. Cole is extremely disrespectful in the face of even the most mundane and basic questions regarding her class. She expects you to know the answers despite never once bringing up a given subject. She came off as harsh, rude, and flat out disrespectful. I would certainly not recommend taking any courses offered by her.

Dr. Cole decides who she likes based on literally nothing and if you are a student she decides she does not like, you'll hate your life when around her. I have received snarky comments from her when simply asking questions. She is rude for no reason and does not care. She makes rude comments about you around other students like a teenager would.

Dr. Cole has no practical experience with horses and refuses to take comments. Her students suffer in many departments because she refuses to communicate with them. I have taken her several times and all have been very tough learning the material.

Most of the materials on exams are not on the slide. You have to go to lectures and take notes from her verbally speaking. Sometimes, she speaks too fast without highlighting what is important or not. The course needs to be more organized. The professor needs to post more material for the student to study not just simply saying something in class.

One of the few classes I've taken that I've actually enjoyed. I learned a ton about horses. Notes aren't online so going to lecture and taking your own notes is important, but otherwise tests are fairly straightforward. Lab material is more difficult, but lab is fun.
Great teacher! I highly recommend her!

Excellent lecturer, I loved Dr. Cole! She was very helpful in lecture and labs. Projects were simple and straightforward. You have to study really well for midterms in this class if you want to do well. The class covers a lot of info and the midterms do too.

Dr. Cole is an awesome professor. Lectures can be so fun and hilarious with her, but I've also gained SO much knowledge about horses (and I'm a horse person to begin with!). Tests are not easy, whether you know horses or not. But as long as you actually study and pay attention it shouldn't be difficult at all to get an A. Overall, a fun class!

When taking either 341 or 201 with her just remember that she is a busy person. It is difficult to get in touch with her. She doesn't return emails often, and she is not in her office as much as she could be. She keeps you after class. Exams are easy if u study, but  with projects in 341, be prepared to work.

Seems to be nice and fun at first but has a temper and will turn and become extremely rude. Can be diffifult to get along with. Her degree is in poulty research and her horse knowledge is good on paper, her practical application of that knowledge is lacking.

He was so funny and engaging. There was one huge paper but he does a great job breaking it up all semester long. Opportunities are given to make up missed assignments or redo them. I was always excited to learn from him, great prof that really cares and tries.

Prof. Stutzman actually cares about his students and what he teaches. The way he grades the class is a bit confusing, but most of his instructions are pretty clear. The exams are mostly common sense and the lectures are pretty light on content. If you don't mind writing, this is a great class to take.

Prof Stutzman is the first instructor I have ever had that clearly cares about his students. He is very passionate about teaching and it shows. I had him for both 2367 & 4597 this semester and his teaching style is amazing! If you show up, participate and do the work you will get the grade you want. Highly recommend for any class!

The lectures are extremely info heavy. It was very hard to discern whether she was giving us information we should know for tests, projects, etc, or if she was just rambling. Very unapproachable professor overall. Prof told me to drop the class when I had a B+ then my grade was tanked due to personal outside of class issues. Not impassible, not fun

Her exams are extremely difficult and include the most tiny detailed things that were only mentioned once in lecture. She won't answer your emails if you send them. She doesn't use rubrics for anything so be prepared to not know why you got the grade you did. Everything she tells you to study for an exam is never actually on the exam.

Professor does not care about you at all. My father passed away and she wouldnt excuse any of the work for me to give me time to grieve. On top of that everything she tells you to study for exams, never shows up on exams. She rushes everything she teaches and never tries to explain it and just expects us to pick it up like a computer. Never again.

This is single-handedly the worst professor I have had in my 4 years at OSU. Her exams are impossibly hard. She's a super tough grader and is not lenient or understanding. I'm convinced she hates her students. I think i'd rather change my major than have to take another class with her
Don't do it, save the anxiety for another class. F her

She's unavoidable if your an Animal Science major/minor, so all I can say is I'm sorry in advance. Does not care about any of her students, and is passive aggressive and rude on the rare occasion you get a response from her if you reach out. I put in a ton of effort and got absolutely nothing from a required class.

Good luck is all I can say. There is so much material in this class and you are expected to remember all of the slides and terminology. The exams are very difficult and are nothing like what she says to study or goes over the day before. She moves very quickly when lecturing and does not slow down. I would recommend talking with your classmates.

The professor is not the best and I wish I had another option to take nutrition with another professor. There is so much information that does not reflect exams at all. This class makes me want to cry every lecture and before every exam.

I've never used rate my professor but I really felt like i needed to warn everyone. DO NOT take her classes, you will fail. She is really that awful. Our entire groupme groupchat can agree. This class has so much information with no direction. I spend so much time studying just for it to not reflect the exams. She does not care about her students.

She is a caring professor, and available outside of class but her exams are so hard and the quizzes too. He gives practices exams and quizzes they are hard but doable. When it comes to exams my friend hold you belt tight cause its harrrd. the average of the first exam was 34 and the highest was 80. the final was around the same

I tried giving this class the benefit of the doubt, but I can't. She throws so much material at you and expects you to memorize every single word she says, without having it written anywhere. She refuses to help on homework (she doesn't provide instructions either). If you have amazing TA's, you need to rely on them because they are your only hope.
Posts so much content and expects you to know everything. Tough grader on discussion posts. Don't recommend.

Highly recomend taking her in person intro course if you want to take this class with her. Its not any more difficult than the intro and it reviews a good deal from that class. This takes animal nutrition a step further than the intro class and is unbearable if you don't have time for this class,12 hr per week. Must have animal expirenceto succeed.
Terrible

Tests are definitely tough but give you all the resources you need to do well on them. Not a hard conceptual class and relies a ton on memorizing facts instead. Compared to other classes, this one comparatively isn't even that hard.

Dr. Peffer is a very approachable and smart teacher who will make you work for your grade. Expect to study the modules inside and out in order to succeed in this class. Also the quizzes are extremely beneficial in reviewing for the exams. If you put the time in to the class it is not a hard class to do well in as exams are reciting basic facts.

She grades extremely hard. She hardly ever hands out full credit. Online her material is so heavy and there is a lot to read. Her exams are EXTREMELY difficult and the averages for exams are always horrible. She is too smart and expects you to know nutrition on her level... take nutrition in the fall with a different professor /:
Do not take this class. I took it for a fun GE and it's been terrible. This class is my lowest grade BY FAR.. Just don't do it.

She 100% will make you work for your grade, but she is very kind and intelligent. There is a lot of material to cover, and she is heavy on remembering pretty small details. Shes so smart and an awesome resource to learn from. You have to study hard, and she grades papers very hard. Put in the work, ask her questions, and youll be fine.

I took this class because I needed it for my major, since it was just the intro class I assumed it would be pretty easy. I was wrong, the class is really well organized and you can find your assignments pretty easy. However you only have 2 assignments a week and they are graded ridiculously hard. On top of that the exams are stupid hard, good luck.
She gives lots of good advice but classwork is more time consuming than it needs to be.

I hated her class. She graded launch seminar like it was a final thesis. I passed the class but she made it so difficult for no reason. I would not recommend her. She is nice and will answer any questions, but she grades hard.
DONOT TAKE HER CLASS!

She never approves leave requests and doesn't respond, even if you send a sincere email asking for leave. Homework deductions are very strictâ€”she always deducts five points. Isn't this course supposed to be easy? When she occasionally cancels class, she doesn't reply to emails and instead sets up an automatic response saying she won't respond.

She won't accept any leave, never responds even if you send a sincere email asking for leave.Homework deduction is very heavy, always deduct five points, isn't this course very easy? When she sometimes cancel class, during which she did not reply to emails,she directly opened the email and automatically replied that she would not reply to emails.

Course is only 7 weeks, and she flies through the lectures! But they are full of a lot of great info, take as many notes as you can. Attendance is mandatory, I missed one class and bc there's few things you're graded on, it did have a pretty sizeable effect. But she's open to feedback abt the course! Recitation is kinda late in the day imo (4pm)

This class had more homework than I thought it would for a .5 credit hour course. Mariette and her group of animal science students did a great job facilitating the course. I learned a lot about our department and I still stay in contact with my TA from this class.
She is very intense, however she only wants the best from you. The class is very easy to get an A and although she says everything how it is, it will make you a better person in the long run.

She's fine, a bit intense, but extremely knowledgeable about the industry. She can be a bit blunt/rough, when speaking about burnout, she basically said you have to figure out to work through it because vet med is competitive... yeah. I don't connect with her often, but when I do, she seems to genuinely care and consider what's in my best interest.

She refuses to consider excused absences of any kind, and is very condescending and rude when you ask about them. Doesnt show a lot of respect for students, and thinks very highly of herself. Unforgiving. Her class should be an easy A, but shes the only professor in CFAES who refuses to acknowledge excused absences.

She is one of the best professors in the department and really cares about her students. She expects good work out of all of her students for all assignments, but if you double check the syllabus for details on things you'll be perfectly fine.

Knows a lot about the industry. Is willing to help you if you ask for it. Expects a lot, but is fair. Grammar and clarity will be accounted for in your work. You are in college after all... Great Advisor!

Obviously considers her position in this class, nevertheless the department, much higher than it actually is. While showing lack of enthusiasm and for the course herself, she expected thorough enthusiasm and perfection in assignments. Contradicting herself and discouraging students, Benage has been one of the most disappointing aspects of OSU.

awesome
Great teacher.  Explains things well, and loves what she does.
Dr.Cole is amazing. I would recommend her for any Horse class. She explains tihngs clearly and is always there if you need help!
Good teacher.  Clear goals and easy to understand.

Despite the course not having much to be graded aside from the occasional quiz, assignments, and exams; I found Wagner to be a very informative and helpful professor during the many times I've had her. She is great at answering questions and really helps with keeping the stress low.

Dr. Wagner is a very caring professor, who genuinely wants you to succeed in her class. This course is lecture heavy, with three midterm exams. The exams grow increasingly more difficult as the semester progresses. I would say she is a tough grader on exams/quizzes/group project assignments, but will help you if you ask her to.

She did not grade until most assignments were submitted. She and Callan took points off, even if you did a great job, simply for not answering every single question in the rubric. Sure, that's fine. If you had graded faster, lol. It was too stressful for a 2000-level class. There were not many human-animal interactions, either.

I love Dr. Wagner's teaching style, specifically in this class. Although this course may be a little dry at times, she kept each class interesting and tried to mix it up every once in a while. She is genuinely interested in student success and will help you if you reach out. I highly recommend her.

There are four exams and a take home final. The lowest exam score is dropped and replaced with the score from the final. There was little homework. The biggest thing was the semester project. I have a high respect for Dr.Wagner and cannot wait to take more of her courses. She is very knowledgeable in her field and has a lot to teach.

Class has 4 exams, weekly quizzes, some homework, a final project, and a final take-home exam. Make sure to study before the exams since the questions can be specific sometimes. Quizzes are take-home too and timed. Overall an easy class if the material is familiar to you. Biology heavy, so be prepared for that. Dr. Wagner is amazing and will help.
Dr. Wagner is a great teacher. She is really passionate about what she teaches. However, the tests are quite difficult and you have to be prepared.

She's a newer teacher so her teaching style  is not as developed as some of the other professors. However, she is a great teacher who really cares about her student's learning. Her tests are kind of difficult, but her slides have all the information you need. I rented the textbook and barely used it.

Overall, a fun and enjoyable class. No textbook, just take notes in class what she says to look over for the exams. Highly recommend attending class. Exam #2 was the hardest, but she gives points back. Overall most grader are quizzes and exams (5).

Pretty straightforward class. You do not need the textbook as you will only need to study slides and DIAGRAMS for exams! test #2 was the hardest as it had the most material. She gives back points on exams for questions where most students miss those questions! I got a 77 on exam #2 and my grade got bumped to an 85 from all the points we got back.

Prof Wagner is a fair teacher when it comes to the classroom. Can seem either slightly unsure of herself or long winded, but makes up for it by making very straightforwad exams. The exams are extremely easy if you memorize the slides and crosswords. Be aware of either diagrams or the muscle contraction steps as they love to make big questions.

Class: 2200.01

Very kind prof, accommodating when I had issues with SLDS. A lot of material but as long as you stay on top of your workload you will be ok. Lectures are eh, not a lot of info on the slides, mainly pics and graphs. I didn't buy the textbook and I was fine. Her exams are hard and don't always reflect what you learned in class.
Brutal class. I'm convinced that you can qualify for the USABO olympiad team and still fail this.

Never again.
