I took the class online during the summer. Took because I thought I could get an easy general education requirement out of the way. Beware if you are taking because of that reason, it is much harder than I expected! Still, the professor is very passionate about what she teaches.

This is not your average easy A online class, so do not rely on just cruising along, you have to work hard. The subject matter of the class is not difficult, but there is a lot of lecture material and the exams can be difficult. Take good notes, go to office hours, take the quizzes multiple times for practice, study hard, and you will be fine.

This was an especially difficult class for first semester freshmen, but if you work hard and pay attention in class, you will be fine. Dr. Peffer can be a tough grader, but she is extremely helpful if you go to office hours and try your absolute best. This was definitely not an easy A (and there was a curve) but it is a great foundational course.

I took her Honors Intro course, did fine but it was HARD. Go to class for lectures, I downloaded the slides & took notes. Her slides are pictures so you NEED to take notes or you wont pass. Tests are half open note online (not much time given), half in person. In person parts are graded to the best students answer. Awesome person though!

Exams were nothing like we learned in the notes; it was open book and I still never scored higher than a C on the exams.I took the most detailed notes of my life for this class and if it wasn't for the curve I would've barely passed.

This professor will penalize you if you fail to present her personal (subjective) view point. If you say what she wants to hear which is ideologically left youll do fine but if not... no matter how much better your work is, if she doesnt agree with it you will get a bad grade. Its a shame teachers can do this to students.

This has been easily the worst class I have taken at Ohio State. O chem is easier than this class. She expects you to have the same level of understanding that she has the moment she says something or written down. Every assignment is graded extremely heavily and the slightest of details off is a massive grade drop. Her exams are impossible.
If you are not in the Animal science major, do not take this class. Because you need to spend a lot of time in this class, however, it does not worth it, since you are not in this major.

For perspective, I got an A in OChem and a C+ in her class... She knows just about everything there is to about animal science and will test you at her level of understanding. I never received a single test back and if you don't go to her office hours, you will never find out what you did wrong. Make her class your #1 priority if you want an A.

Dr. Peffer treats her intro classes as a way to weed out people who aren't serious about animal sciences. If you want to take class with her just for fun, don't. Dr. Peffer is extremely knowledgable in her field and I think she's a nice person. However, she is also very much a stickler for the rules and will go through lecture very fast.

I took her intro class and did terrible the first time around- i failed. I did take notes, and studied those notes, but you need to study so much more than that (you pretty much need to know what the book says word for word). So when i retook the class, i made sure to know the book and I ended up doing fairly well on the exams.

Expect to read, read, read, study, study, study, and read and study more! An introductory class she teaches is an information overload. Quizzes and tests are very difficult and will cover specific details. Learn from my experience, you will struggle to succeed in her class. I asked for guidance, her response, drop the class!

There's no doubt that Peffer talks a mile a minute, but she's really knowledgeable and a decent person. I wrote down almost everything she said, studied my lecture notes after every class, and made flashcards for the little details (because she does test you on them!). Overall not as terrible as I was expecting.

She knows everything there is to know about animal sciences but she expects her students to know the same. There is too much information that she expects us to know and gives no clue what is going to be on the tests.  I thought i was failing the entire time and ended up passing because of the curve. Just go to class and study HARD.

Peffer definitely knows her stuff. I liked her, but she is tough. I had a decent time because I enjoyed the topics we discussed, but I had to work hard for my grade. Her exams are unbelievably hard, but she will amaze you with the stuff you talk about.

I had a really awesome time taking her class. She really cares about her students and if you go to her office and ask her questions she's more than willing to help. I've learned a lot from her class. Tips for this class would be bring a recorder to record lectures, ask lots of questions, and have a study buddy !

Do not take this class unless you are an animal science major. The exams are really hard and about topics that she talks about for two minutes during one class. She wrote the textbook so she knows everything but she will also go beyond the textbook. Most of the material on the tests are from her lectures and she talks a mile a minute so good luck!

I strongly recommend against ever taking this course as a general requirement.  This may seem like a "easy class" but the professor makes it anything but.  The lectures are way too fast paced and are hard to follow, and you have to memorize the book to have a chance.  This is the hardest class I have taken here, and the professor is the main reason

I failed the first time I took this class, so I had to retake it. You basically need to know the book word for word (she wrote it) and her lectures word for word to get a good grade. Her exams and quizzes are extremely specific, so KNOW EVERYTHING. I put so much effort into this class the second time around and still ended up with a C. Good luck.

DO NOT TAKE as a GEN Ed!!  Impossible!  No matter how much i studied couldn't get better than a D.  I attended every single class and studied my brains out...I am typically an A/B student.  The tests/quizzes are impossible!  TEacher does not respond to email!  At office hours really doesn't help at all!  Do yourself a favor and don't take it!

It's amazing that THE Ohio State University holds their students to such a high standard, yet they have a professor like this teaching their classes.  It does not matter how much you prepare for tests, it will be awful.  The course I took was an intro elective course for some, yet she teaches it like it is an upper-level major course.  Do not take!

She's too smart, wrote the textbook and doesn't know what it contains and what got edited out. She expects you to know it all basically. Her slides are posted online but its usually graphs and pictures. You have to go to every lecture to take notes. She talks at the speed of lightning. The only reason Im passing this class is because of the curve.

She is very rude.  She talks quickly and gets annoyed with students when they don't immediately grasp what she is saying.  She is unwilling to work with scheduling conflicts, even if they are for another university class and cannot be helped.  She acts  as if her class is the most important class ever, even if it is just survey. Avoid at all costs.

Talks really fast in class. Pretty much gives you a whole book of information in one class period. Impossible to keep up with. She expects you to remember pretty much everything she says. The notes she post online are useless. Impossible tests. You wont pass

the book its self is poorly written with many typos and errors, so much that I find it almost hindering to read.  her test are specific and she talks very fast in class, and when someone asks a question she does little to clarify and often doesn't know the answers. I will admit i have never tried to meet during her office hours.

Her midterms are impossible, she give half in class and the other half on Carmen. if you read the book you somewhat understand but once she lectures you are lost. she know what she is talking about but doesn't make it easy to learn. if you don't understand digestion you will fail the class that is her specialty.

I don't suggest taking this class, especially if you don't have the time to sit down with a recording of the lecture and copy it word for word. The tests are impossibly hard, and EXTREMELY specific! If you have to take it, take it with another professor.
She's impossible.  Not helpful.  Exam questions are ridiculous.
Never responds to emails, gives unclear information with conflicting number values, unnecessarily hard tests, and disabled the comment box on her student evaluation.

She wrote the textbook, and expects you to know basically every word of it.  The tests are really detailed, but by the second one you figure out her style and they are more manageable.  She talks very fast so beware.  Also, make sure you get the text book! I take all of my notes directly in it and find that it is really helpful

This class was definitely a challenge. Be ready to work hard! It was a requirement for my major and I've been around livestock my whole life so it wasn't impossible, but I can understand how it would be even more difficult for someone with no animal science background. Reach out for help and keep up with the readings. GO TO CLASS. You'll be fine :)

Do NOT take this class unless it is required for your major. I really enjoyed her as a person, not so much as a teacher. She is very helpful if you take the time to come in for office hours. Answers to quizzes can be found on a lot of quizlets. You have to take thorough notes and attend lectures all the time.

This class was the hardest I've ever taken. It was an interesting topic, but even after going to every lecture, keeping up with the readings, and taking thorough notes, I struggled on the quizzes and exams. The questions seem like random sentences from the textbook. So if you do not need this class for your major, I highly recommend not taking it.

Absolute worst professor I've ever had at both universities I've attended. I probably would have gotten a better grade on the tests if I didn't show up at all. They are impossible, even if you memorize the textbook. She's so inconsiderate of the fact this is the first animal science course some people are taking. Terrible teacher, avoid the class.

Dr. Peffer is a very nice lady, but she is way too smart. She talks way too fast, saying things as in 'oh you already know this, i'm not going into detail,' and expects you to remember everything she says. You end up HAVING to record the lectures, just so you can rewrite all of your notes down. There are many topics that aren't in the text, either.

Dr. Peffer is a great teacher, and I enjoyed her class because she is really nice and funny but sometimes too smart. I got an A in this class without a problem, but I also always attended, sat in the first or second row, wrote down EVERYTHING she said and studied like crazy. Don't take it if you don't have to. Also not having her as a prof again

This class isn't hard if you go to lecture every day and take good notes, you get out what you put in.  I think Dr. Peffer wants students to do well, but challenges them at the same time.  If you are polite and ask for it, she will gladly help you.

I loved Pasha as a person, I just could not stand the way she taught. I had to record her lectures because she talks so fast. Even the recording did not help. The first test you will most likely fail, but after you get the hang of it it gets sort of better. The labs are awesome. HIGHLY recommend NOT TAKING THE HONORS VERSION.

definitely knows her stuff, but she can't balance her knowledge and teaching an intro class fairly. There is a lot of material, which is manageable but her quizzes and tests are still IMPOSSIBLE, poorly worded, confusing. If you miss a class you're screwed. Take amazing notes and write down every word and you won't need the book but she talks fast.
Pasha.. I highly recommend that you DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS as a gen ed. If it's not required for your major don't take it. Even if it is, take it with someone else.

The lectures are so boring but you have to stay awake and very alert because everything she says can be on the test, verbatim. She is somewhat vague during her lectures about what is important and what isn't.  Tests are so difficult , especially considering I'm taking this as a GE (and it's an intro course, sorry to all you Animal Science majors).

I do not suggest taking this class as an elective and if this class is required for your major try your best to take it with another instructor. Her test are hard and not worded great. If you have this class will her pay attention to the book and the photos of the book do your best to know everything in and out.

there isnt any clarity it seemed like she only glossed over stuff also it was hard to prepare for the tests because she explained the material that would be on the test so vaguely. i basically had to teach myself it  was frustrating

Dr. Peffer loves to lecture and teach students. However, she expects you to know everything verbatim.  This makes studying difficult and no matter what you will feel like you aren't prepared.  If you aren't ready to put in the time, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.  On the other hand, she is more than willing to help you and does have office hours.

Don't even get me started on this professor. This is by far the hardest class I have ever taken in college. She non stop talks during her lectures and expects you to know all the information that exists her mouth. Her tests are near impossible to get higher than at 70% on. She doesn't comprehend the fact that you aren't as knowledgable as she is.
I appreciated Dr.Peffer. You do have to work to get a straight answer from her, but she is very willing to allow multiple interpretations of correct answers on essay questions. I enjoyed the course.

Tests were very hard and all info from lectures should be memorized. However, Dr. Peffer is very passionate and that shows through her thorough teaching. She makes a point to stop for questions if anyone needs help and is available for office hours. She is also a very nice person.

Terrible. Tests are incredibly difficult for an introductory level class, questions are worded in such a manner as to render them terribly confusing, the class averages of exams have consistently been 75% or lower. To put it simply, if you're trying for a biology gen ed: Do NOT take a class with Peffer. Nice lady, terrible professor.

Pasha is very passionate about what she teaches, but that did not lessen the load.  For an intro level course, that has an OPTIONAL lab and can be taken by non majors, it is completely ridiculous.  Pasha packs obscene amounts of info into a lecture, barely stopping to breath, and expects students to remember everything that comes out of her mouth.
Terrible Professor!
I liked her fairly well. You really have to work to get a straight answer from her, but she tries to help.

This is the worst teacher I have ever had! Her quizzes and tests are IMPOSSIBLE. She expects you to remember word for word exactly what she said in the lecture so even if you reference the textbook you could still be wrong. She should stick to research because she does not know how to teach people AT ALL! This class ruined my GPA and my semester.

One of the worst professors I've had.  As a 3rd year pre-vet student this class has relevant and interesting content for me, but (she's american) Pasha has pronunciation and grammar so bad that it confuses me on her exams (which are as detail-oriented and specific as everyone is saying) and makes it really hard for me to think she's competent.

Dr. Peffer is really not THAT bad. She expects you to learn a lot of information, even the non important stuff but if you study, go to lecture, and have thorough notes you'll be fine. First exam  got a 71 and then stepped up my game and ended up with an A. Print out her notes before lecture, helps A LOT!
Awful teacher.  Not willing to help students at all and has insane expectations. Ex: Wants every detail included in a paper but only allows it to be one page

maybe she's different now or i'm a teachers pet, but i love Dr P. yeah, its way too hard for an intro level class but she's VERY open to questions and always willing to help via email, after class or in her office. this is a great prep class if you are an animal sci major because she thoroughly touches a section from every class you'll take later.

Very interesting class and material is engaging.  Dr. Peffer is very nice, and clear about information (and there is a LOT!)Try not to miss any lectures like I did because you will be sorry when the exam comes. She expects you to know everything she discussed down to the smallest detail so be prepared. Take good notes,read the book and study!

HORRIBLE AS A TEACHER! Expectations are ridiculous and helpful is not a word I would use to describe her when it comes to class assignments. I don't think there was an different professor who was also teaching this class, but if there is TAKE THEIR CLASS, NOT THE ONE SHE TEACHES. Also, the average of the class was a low C for a capstone course.....

Good lectures. Interesting material. IMPOSSIBLE EXAMS. She expects you to memorize EVERYTHING. Everything mentioned in class, everything from every diagram in the book. And she gives nothing to practice with. I studied for about an hour per day and read the book word for word and almost failed the class

She came to class the first day and said "I know I have a reputation of tricking students, but I'm not out to trick you." She goes over a lot of material and A LOT of numbers. Memorize every graph and every number.The study guides are completely irrelevant & info on the last study guide that was said "will not be on exam" was def on the final!

I started out think that this class might be alright. The labs are interesting and Lectures are good...however then came the tests, they are ridiculous you basically get like 45 min to do 45 problems which include long paragraph questions, confusing fill in the blanks and graphs. Ive even heard TA's say they hate this class, just awful.

Extremely detailed tests. Sometimes on material that was very negligible. There's no way one person can memorize all of the material she wants you to memorize. Best suggestion is to read chapters twice and take really good notes and go to class EVERYDAY! On a good note though, she's a good lecturer.
Very unclear about exams and unavailable for help.

I have read some of these comments and they do not give Dr. Peffer credit. She is a wonderful teacher. I will admit I got frustrated with her exams, but she has the right to test us like she does. She wants to make sure we know our material and know it well. I studied very hard in this class, which I expected to do, worked hard, and got an A.

One of the worst teachers I've had in my  academic career. Rude and disdainful towards students, her grading the completely subjective and and follows no clear guidlines. She grades your responses compared to other students because and i guote "im too intelligent to grade against what i know"... Can she not grade based on the notes and book?? NO GO

Dr. Peffer is one of the best lecturers I have ever been around, but she is also one of the toughest. I think what makes her so hard is that she teaches this 200 level class, and then she also teaches a 700 level graduate class. Study, study, study, and never miss a lecture. If you do, you are out of luck because her exams are hard and DETAILED.

This teacher was the worse professor I?ve ever had. Miserable. I went to class every day, and studied so hard and got a D. it ruined my whole GPA, not to mention it didn?t even count as a science for my major.  She is very strict with proper emails, and responded nastily because i didn?t use periods and capitals. End of story DONT TAKE HER
Fantastic professor. Made lecture fun and interesting. Subject matter cool. Very helpful and knowledgeable. I highly recommend Dr. Peffer.

This was the worst professor I've had in four years of undergraduate study at two universities. Horrible grader, gives completely unfair tests, and makes no attempt whatsoever to help students. Horrible class, horrible professor.

Animal science is my major, and I really did enjoy learning the information. But having to deal with Dr. Peffer was more than challenging. She chooses which students she dislikes whether she has a reason to or not. Her tests are long, and more difficult than she implies. She's unfair grader and takes unnecessary points off. Don't take it from her.

Very hard class, especially for a 200 level. Tests are way too hard. Asks you to memorize way to much. The way to get an A is to suck up to her- big time! She hates me and I never did anything to deserve it. Ive overheard her talking about how stupid her students are and complaining about the students lack of willingness to learn the material.

worst teacher I have encountered at OSU.  TERRIBLE.  awful lecturer. backwards grader.  takes excessive points off for the stupidest crap, both on tests AND papers.  It's like being back in high school with her.  She doesn't care at all about the students.  She doesn't know anything about any animal except pigs.  AWFUL TEACHER.

Great lecturer!  I had no interest in animal science when I took the class, and left wishing I would have majored in it.  She goes out of her way to answer questions, but if she doesn't know she'll be honest and then find it for you.  Exam are very fair, labs are good, and the guest lecturers are great.  I highly recommend Dr. Peffer! :-)
Rude, not there for the students, and self absorbed. No more needs to be said.

Very nice professor, helpful in answering questions if she sees your hand raised. If not, she'll answer questions after class. It is a lot of information but if you stay on top of it, it isn't so bad. The tests are hard but initially fair. All in all, great class, the labs were fun, the extra credit options were fun and helpful as well.

lot of information to study.  tests are too long for time given.  different testing style with multiple choice and fill-in-the-blank, not typical.  very helpful and always available to ask questions.  great with interacting with students.  honest. passionate about work. even though does research, still has time for students.

She is a great teacher. Her exams are really tough. However, with the labs and the extra credit she gives, its not that bad. Very easy to understand, and keeps my attention. Always willing to help or answer a question

OK. I totally hated this teacher, and as a result, the entire class, even though animal science is very interesting to me. For one, she screams her lectures, instead of speaks. Second, she makes an introductory course more like a 500 level class. She will not answer your emails. She is terrible at posting grades, she takes forEVER. AND she is rude.

Dr. Peffer was not an easy teacher.  I really liked the content covered and the labs. We have many papers in her class and the tests are tough. The lab grade counts as a big part of the grade so there are ways to earn points besides the tests.  She also offered one or two ways to earn bonus.  She is tough but I liked the class. I ended up with a B+
I did not like Dr.Peffer at all.  She talked down to us and it seemed like she was only nice to us because she had to be.  There was a lot of material covered and her tests are impossible.

He was so funny and engaging. There was one huge paper but he does a great job breaking it up all semester long. Opportunities are given to make up missed assignments or redo them. I was always excited to learn from him, great prof that really cares and tries.

Prof. Stutzman actually cares about his students and what he teaches. The way he grades the class is a bit confusing, but most of his instructions are pretty clear. The exams are mostly common sense and the lectures are pretty light on content. If you don't mind writing, this is a great class to take.

Prof Stutzman is the first instructor I have ever had that clearly cares about his students. He is very passionate about teaching and it shows. I had him for both 2367 & 4597 this semester and his teaching style is amazing! If you show up, participate and do the work you will get the grade you want. Highly recommend for any class!

Yes this class has A LOT of information and can be intimidating to cram in seven weeks, but a lot of the exam material is fairly straightforward and some questions come STRAIGHT FROM THE PRACTICE QUIZZES. Lecture is in person on Tuesday, it can be hard to pay attention because its a 2 hour class. Thursday is annoying. Come for attendance it counts.
Lectures are now in person on Tuesdays which consists of many power points and material is covered very quickly, followed by an unnecessary review on Thursdays. Class can be a bit unorganized.

Expects you to watch many hours of lecture videos every week, so don't get behind. Class is kinda pointless because it is mainly just group work and tophat. Exams are focused on review questions and tophat. He grades harshly on the extended responses and does not give much feedback. The final project wasn't super bad and is a good grade booster.

He doesn't really teach and ends up talking about things not related to the course materials. Also for the final assignment his rubric was lacking of his expectation for the project and feedback was absoluetly useless then he changed the weight of the assignment after he started putting in grades.

You're teaching yourself all the material in this class. His exams are extremely hard and treats everyone like they are already in vet school (we're not??). The one class a week is spent doing tophat questions and filling out a post it around the room, and is a total waste of time. All I can say is good luck and maybe try to find a different class.
Waste of my time. The worst, most annoying class set up I've ever taken.

Bro took a 2 credit hour class and turned it into 4. He puts his lectures all online and the in class time we have is wasted. He makes 80 ppl move around a small room. I don't have time to watch an hour+ worth of lectures outside of class time. He clearly doesn't care about checking his SEI bc students who took this class before had the same prob

Class was a lot of info in a few weeks but overall I learned a lot. 3-5h of lecture videos that were boring at times, but take good notes and make a quizlet on things he goes over in review/study the tophats as that is most helpful for exams (majority of your grade). Do the practice quizzes too & final project is easy.

Animal health 1: this is a reflected classroom! You teach yourself everything based on slideshows and come to class and do review on tophat. Only 3 exams, each one worth ~20% of your grade, but I felt prepared. Great guy, but not very hands on due to nature of course. Lots of material to get through every week, so don't fall behind.

He is a fairly good lecturer and his classes are pretty good;unfortunately, his inability to answer emails is the big issue I had. I sent multiple emails on multiple occasions with questions pertaining to the class, and only once did I get a response 2 weeks after I sent the message. If you never need to email/reach out for anything, you'll be fine
The modules for the week were rarely posted on time
Professor Cressman is cool and very knowledgeable in cooking. I learned a good amount from him.

The class is made up of weekly discussion posts, quizzes, and exams. The content is not difficult, but the modules were never posted on time. Syllabus stated 5pm on Mondays but oftentimes the content was published on Tuesday evenings/Wednesday mornings. No discussion posts were graded until the end. Overall easy class, just not structured well.

Though there are no textbooks, there is supplemental reading every week. There are weekly assignments and a weekly exam. The final took a very long time and you should prepare to use the whole time given. The information is outdated and some of it is even considered wrong today.
I took MEATSCI 2010 (BBQ Science) with Dr. Cressman and it was an awesome class. He's an awesome educator and truly wants you to learn. Great guy and great class!

2200.03 online was based on weekly quizzes, weekly module exams, and weekly packback discussions. Everything was pretty straightforward and easy to understand. Make sure to get everything done and you'll be fine. Overall, good class and good prof.

This was a great class to take as a GPA science booster class. I highly recommend. All of the assignments were on Carmen. There was an additional discussion post graded by AI, which was kind of cool as well. I highly recommend this class and professor.
This was an amazing class! Basically, the quizzes and exams were multiple choice on Carmen, and it was so nice.

I took this class online and it was great! The material was very interesting and the embedded learning quizzes and module exams were extremely doable if you read the material. Dr. Cressman always commented on group discussions and was available if there were any questions or troubles. I was unsure if I'd like the online setting, but it was fun!

I liked Dr. Cressman, he's hilarious. But I think he went a little too in-depth for the class itself, it's supposed to be a basic intro. It does not have a biology prerequisite, but it should if he is going to incorporate so much biology concepts into the material.

This class was like being taught by an extremely intelligent puppy. Dr. Cressman genuinely cares about his students and his material, and although his lectures can get a little muddled, he explains things in detail if you ask. Very smart guy, I would take this class every semester if I had to.
Dr. Cressman was awesome!! He really goes into detail on exams just to make sure you understand what you're learning. He's a great professor and a great guy.

He is a smart man, and loves his job. he often brings in examples to class to assist in our learning, but his test can be challenging if you dont study or go to class. over all hes a nice guy and knows what he is talking about and if you are having trouble go to him during his office hours he will be more than willing to help

He's is great. He really keeps your attention. He doesn't "lecture", he makes it fun. I learned & retained a lot from his class. He is very intelligent and respected, but he is also a normal guy that you can talk to outside of class like you're buddies. Pop quizzes- if you attend class you know they're coming. Exams are slightly difficult but fair.
He is a good professor, tests are pretty hard because he expects yo to know everything in full.  He is a nice guy, but he does like to tease students, so don't take it personally.

Dr. Cressman is a genuinely nice guy and wants his students to learn. You can tell he is very intelligent and knows the subject matter well. Can be confusing, but if you ask questions he'll help. He always held question and answer sessions before tests and allowed you to come to office hours after to talk about things you did wrong after tests.
Dr. Cressman is a really nice guy!! He is a tough grader, but it's only because he wants you to understand the material. He's laid back and has a really adorable smile!
I loved Dr. Cressman! He's a little tough on his grading, but it's only because he wants you to understand the whole concept he's teaching. He's super laid back and has an adorable smile!

Dr. Cressman is new to Ohio State but I have him this semester for half of ANISCI 2100 along with Dr. Ana Hill. Cressman is a genuinely nice guy very laid back and very helpful when you ask him questions. He goes a lot into the chemistry and biological details of animal science though so don''t expect an easy A. Tough course but he will help you.

does not take like an introductory course, while the quizzes were able to be taken unlimited times the exams worth around 67% of your whole grade (there's only 3) were almost impossible, the quizzes seemed pretty straight forward but the exams were on a who different level. I would recommend staying away from this class at all costs.
Material on exams was not covered in the notes hardly ever

Definitely did not take like an intro class, very difficult and lecture heavy. The unannounced assignments and mini quizzes were annoying but not the worst. The exams were very difficult as he was looking for specific answers and often asked questions that required a bit more in-depth research beyond what was talked about during lecture.
Very boring professor. I would have waited to take the class or taken with a different prof if it would have been possible.
Avoid if possible.

Pretty boring lecturer. His unannounced pop quizzes are impossible, giving you a very small window of time to answer confusing questions. He's a pretty hard grader and will not give feedback on your work, and instead will post "benchmark answers" to written exams leaving you to figure out why you got points off. Do the in person lecture if you can.

While you can tell that he is knowledgeable, he is terrible at explaining in a meaningful way. Lectures will put you to sleep until the 5 minute 5 question pop quiz with horrendous wording and even worse answers. The exams seem completely arbitrary grading wise, if you don't put in the exact keywords he wants, you get a C
Not helpful at all. Never answers questions. Very boring, too. Highly don't recommend taking his class.

Long, boring, extremely detailed lectures. This class is intense and he grades really tough. As others mentioned he is very friendly and was always quick to respond to emails but this class is ROUGH, especially for an introductory class. Even though the class is online you have to attend because there are multiple timed pop quizzes.
Dr. Kinder is a very nice and smart man but the problem is, he expects you to also be just as smart as he is and grades really harsh. The "intro" class is not an intro level at all.
Worst teacher

Dr. Kinder is a very boring lecturer. He has tons of pop quizzes which have a tiny 5 minute window to take them. Exams are very hard. He expects extremely detailed answers about things not even mentioned in the questions with a very small word limit based on a vague, open to interpretation question. Avoid this class at all costs.

I took his course online and the lecture itself was quite boring.  His rubric for the final assignment weren't very clear, with the only criteria being to convince him you understand the subject. Other than that, the course content was quite clear and he taught well, but he doesn't do much to keep the class engaged.

Dr. Kinder is a good person overall and cares about his students, but that's about it. Lecture is VERY heavy in content & the exams only require you to write about a couple of topics (throw a bunch of vocab words in and you're alright) and he does pop quizzes. I like the content as someone but other than that, I did not really enjoy the class

Dr. Kinder is very knowledgeable and does a good job at explaining the material in lecture, but it can get boring and repetitive. There are many pop quizzes throughout the class that are difficult to finish in the time allotted. His exam questions are worded weirdly and he does not curve them.

if you have to take this class, take it with a different professor. Professor kinder is horrible at explaining things in a way that students can understand, moves way too fast and is NOT lenient or understanding with grades. On our most recent exam, NO students got higher than a 90 and there are over 100 students in the class. RED FLAG

Kinder is a really sweet man who cracks a few funny jokes! He is a unique person who is entertaining to hear speak, but also, extremely boring and hard to listen to. His exams are hard, because he words the questions SO weirdly. It's like he expects you to immediately pick up on complex information. Material is very heavy. Be ready to study!
Good class for being online - other than having to buy a separate online platform - nothing is on carmen except grades so be careful when assignments are due. Overall really easy and clear.

lectures are BORING and the class is quiz and exam heavy. You have to buy Grand River Learning to do the exams and quizzes and there are weekly packback assignments. Also, because there is a separate platform for quizzes/exams it will not be on your to-do list on Carmen Canvas, so make sure you don't forget about them.

Very monotone in his online lectures. Think it's another professor's voice in lectures. 
You will be paying for packback and this other online course called Great River Learning which is roughly and extra $100.00 just for this class. This class was required. I don't have an extra $100 to give out aside from the thousands I spend on tuition.
She is very kind and knowledgeable, and I highly recommend her.

Dr. Kenney is a good professor just a little unorganized and its hard to find everything needed on carmen. This was a fairly simple class just wish someone would help him with setting up the class a little better.

I absolutely loved Dr. L!! Her lectures are fun and interactive. She's young which is a huge plus. Definitely is still learning as a professor but is super open to feedback. Lab practicals are harder than the lecture exams. Dedicate more time to studying than you think you need to. But she is a super caring person and she is there to help you!

Lab practicals were the hardest portion of this class. Because of the amount of material, there is a lot of studying involved. Dr Lichtenwalter is pretty clear about what will be on the exam/practicals but also wants to challenge her students. She is a very relatable teacher and makes lectures fun and enjoyable.

Dr. Eastridge is genuinely the best animal science teachers at The Ohio State University. He truly cares about his students and supporting them in their academic and career goals. If you attend lecture, participate in lab, and put effort into group projects you will pass this class and leave with great connections.

Loved his classes, one of the most caring and inspiring members of the Animal Science Department. He really cares about his students and their interests. Class work is reasonable and if you take it seriously, can open a lot of avenues for involvement and discussion. 10/10 would recommend his classes and would take any class he teaches again!

Dr. Eastridge is one of the most caring professors at OSU and if you have the chance to take a class with him I highly recommend!! The field trips are really fun and I would definitely take this class again and any other class with him.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS IF YOU ARE ACTUALLY INTERESTED IN DAIRY AS A PROFESSION!!!! A ton of group projects, VERY time-consuming (including having to be at the farm at 6am), lots of field trips (including having to free up your whole Friday night until 11 pm, and presenting on a Saturday). If you have a busy schedule, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!
Very informative class with many guest lectures. SO many field trips and group projects. A lot of time needs to be put into this class
Dr. Eastridge is the most wonderful person you will ever meet. Want a fun and exciting new adventure at OSU? Take his classes they are UDDDERLY the best.

I didn't mind this class, it was a little boring sometimes since he does tend to read off the slides, but it's nothing horrible. The exams are pretty straight forward if you read the slides and study the material he gives out. I thought he was nice and easy to get ahold of to answer any questions I had, and will give out plenty of studying methods!

Lectures are very dry, he is just reading off the slides 90% of the time and is clearly not super knowledgeable about most things. He knows about meat production but is lacking in micro anatomy and most other physiology things. There is a lot of material, but nothing out of the blue on quizzes or exams. If you know the slides, you'll be fine.
The 8am lectures were so dry, he basically just reads everything off the slides. There is a LOT of material, so stay on top of your workload and do the extra credit.

DO the extra credit for the exams; it makes a huge difference on your exam grades! Ben is easygoing, the lectures can be a bit dry, and going to class isn't required. The exams were fairly difficult with the amount of content covered, although I was fine just studying the review the TAs sent out a few days prior to the exam.

Took animal physiology with him. Overall, he was a good professor. Understanding, flexible, and clear. The class itself was structured easily; 4 exams and 8 quizzes, with no other assignments. The material is difficult simply because there is a lot of material, but I felt he made it very fair, and did not make it complicated.
Simply looking to reconnect after having left college education for extended military service. I do not care about this service's guidelines or continuity.

Excellent professor. I learned so much in this class. Anatomy was really hard for me when working with dog/cat cadavers, but she never gave up and gave many chances through other assignments to improve test scores

Dr. Grum was such a fun and caring professor. Labs in this class were very fun but beware for the practicals! If you get a bad grade on the practical do not worry the tests were pretty easy and will boost your grade. I love Dr. Grum and would recommend this class to anyone!

She made my semester and this course extremely unpleasant to be in. She holds grudges against college students for the entire semester if you rub her the wrong way. She was not helpful in any degree of the word. She would send rude and unprofessional emails to students as soon as a few weeks into the semester saying she thinks they will fail. Sad.
2200.03 is very easy, 2 weekly quizzes and Quizlets available to review module materials for the exam quiz. Packbacks are easy too and info is interesting.

Animal Systems online is overall a pretty easy class. Dr. Grum and Dr. Cressman both offer a lot of insight and are approachable outside of class too. Lots of reading, but as long as you take notes the module exams and activity quizzes are easy. Discussion posts aren't through Carmen though, they're on a site called Packback which is interesting.

Each week, there is a 25 question quiz over a massive document that discusses a different class of animal (pigs, horses, cattle, dogs, etc.). The quizzes are pretty straightforward. There's really no reason you'd need to contact the professors, but they were active in emailing the class about deadlines. In addition there is Packback, which is $20.

2200.03 online was based on weekly quizzes, weekly module exams, and weekly packback discussions. Everything was pretty straightforward and easy to understand. Make sure to get everything done and you'll be fine. Overall, good class and good prof.

Was looking for an easy A bio class, this seemed to fit the bill. It was very interesting, had very clear criteria. Some of the wording was very tricky and made it easy to miss a few questions. Basically just pay attention, and read the questions.
This was an amazing class! Basically, the quizzes and exams were multiple choice on Carmen, and it was so nice.

Easy class with long reading weekly on a different animal. Tests were easy aside the need to watch wording, I was tricked a few times my first test quiz and got a B on it. Weekly quiz, 10 question quiz on an articlle, and 3 group discussio posts. No book is needed and it was only a half semester class.

I took this class online and it was great! The material was very interesting and the embedded learning quizzes and module exams were extremely doable if you read the material. Dr. Grum always commented on group discussions and was available if there were any questions or troubles. I was unsure if I'd like the online setting, but it was fun!
Overall, excellent professor. Keeps material interesting and topical. You will know why you are learning the information and how to apply it in the real world,

I haven't a bad thing to say about Dr. Grum. Her ability to turn nutrition into an easy to follow along story is unique and phenomenal. She also cares so much and will do anything for you to help you if you are struggling or behind. She's also a great life coach.  Beware: Ana will match your effort. If you don't care/try, don't waste her time.

Dr. Grum is BY FAR one of the best professors. She is hilarious, kind, and always surprises you with what she says. She was a vet for years and knows what she's talking about. She can't take any more advisees because she has too many, because everyone wants to work with her. I can't wait to take more classes with her.
She was one of the best professors I've had at Ohio state, her lectures were actually fun to go to, she is great.

She is one of the best professors ive ever had. she is funny and has no filter (which could be a bad thing if you get on her bad side) she gives lots of examples in class, and teaches us not just the course material, but general life lessons. if you ever get the chance to have her you wont leave that class with out laughing.

Absolute best professor I've ever had. She's always willing to help students and the material in the class is relevant for anyone looking to go into an animal related career. I would HIGHLY recommend her as a professor and would gladly take another class with her.

Dr Grum is by far my favorite professor so far.  She is very clear, and breaks up her lectures with stories from her veterinary practice.   She also actually cares about her students.  When  I was trying to find a summer internship she happily gave me suggestions, then followed up with me on how everything turned out. Amazing professor :)
This course was fun and very hands on. Nicole Lorig was very caring and was a great lecturer. I would definitely take again!
I learned a lot from her. She is extremely understanding and welcoming in the classroom.

I learned so much from her, and she had a positive attitude every single day. Friendly and approachable, I wish I had talked with her more honestly. She's a hands on prof, she doesn't just talk at you and the cut you loose, she teaches you and then helps you apply the concepts, working with the animals right alongside you.

Overall the class was pretty straightforward. A packback question and two responses every week and open book/note quizzes. Exams had some repeat questions and were also open note with lots of time. The "computer assignments" had step by step instruction provided. Definitely watch lectures on 2x speed.
Most monotone guy you'll ever meet. Very boring class. Very, very boring.

Dr. Wenner is the best professor I have ever experienced. He desires success for his students and provided numerous extra credit opportunities, along with chances to re-learn challenging material. I can confidently affirm that I learned more in this class and have retained more than in any other college class I've taken. Dr. Wenner is the best!

Wenner is a nice guy, and he records the lectures for you to review after class. Class consists of quizzes, homework, and exams. He gives lots of opportunities for extra credit. The homework doesn't always seem to pertain to what we learn, but other than the the exams are fair. Not my favorite class, but Wenner made it okay.

He's really nice and gives extra credt! I'm not super into nutrition so halfway through the sem it was hard to focus, but GO TO LECTURE. The people who complained and did bad on midterm 2 are the same ones who skipped class often. If you go every lecture and review the study Qs at the end of each lecture you'll do well on all quizzes + exams!

Really down-to-earth prof. Seemed to go out of his way to help us succeed with plenty of extra credit and by basically giving us the exam questions prior to the test as a study guide. The final was about 80% all from this pool of questions he gave us.

Dr. Wenner is amazing. He offers so many extra credit opportunities. Quiz questions are almost word for word from the slides. Exams include quiz questions and student-submitted questions (extra credit!). Final is cumulative, based on frequently-missed questions (he gives them to you before the exam), quizzes, and student-submitted questions.

Dr. Wenner made the lecture very enjoyable and dynamic. He brought different speakers to give perspective on small ruminant production, provided a national and global perspective during class, and gave us a business project as an assignment.

I loved Dr. Wenner's nutrition class. The material was interesting and he was so into it that it made me want to go to class everyday. That being said, make sure you go to class because he will talk about something that will be on the test but is not in the notes. Tests are super fair, HWs are a bit tougher but you can drop one so choose carefully.

Dr. Wenner made lecture very enjoyable to attend. An A is not easily earned in this class; the material is heavy and he tends to move quickly through it. Most of his exam questions are application questions, so they won't come straight from his slides. You have to really know the material to excel, and attending lecture is a must.

Lazy waste of space professor. The man will not teach his own classes, learn how to communicate with the overly confident GTA's. Avoid if at all possible. Refuses to clarify on many odd wordings and if you ask him about it he WILL deduct points from your score. Worthless!
honestly not a bad guy. id have him again

A very interesting Teaching asst. Extremely passionate. kinda quiet. He said this was his last semester as a ta and seemed down about it. He cut me a break more times than I can count. Told me once that he became the ta he wished he had in this course when he took it. I graduated this semester cause of him

this ta helped me pass the course. my other tas have been no where near as kind as Jordan was. I don't know why there's a TA on ratemy professor, but I'm glad he is on here. Very funny (even though sometimes it's 
'dad joke funny" cringe). super helpful all throughout the course. glad I had him. wish more TAs were like Jordan. recommend this course

Jordan i feel like was not in sync with the professor about the expectations we were expected to fulfill. he did a great job overall and was probably one of the nicest and smartest tas ive met, but the coordination between him and the professor coulda been better. you can definitely tell his heart is in it.

i dont think ive ever seen a ta on ratemyprofesssor before but im going to give it a shot and rate him anyway. came off as as asshole, but then learned he just has a different personality that's more quiet. he's very caring and empathetic. helped me a lot. wouldnt have been able to pass w/o him. that was my lesson not to judge a book by its cover.

Alright so Jordan is very passionate and knowledgeable but sometimes has a very boring monotone voice. He helped me a lot throughout this course. Probably did more than he needed to, so can't complain much. His passion sounded like rambling on about off topic stuff sometimes though. Should fix that.

This is my first time making a post about a ta or prof on this site, but jordan is by far the best person ohio state has ever hired to help students. To say he goes above and beyond is putting it lightly. He makes it almost impossible to fail and puts all his time into helping you. He did this when i got in an accident and had to take time off.

Jordan sent out a really inspirational email, which I so desperately needed at the time. When I complained about a grade I had received, Jordan walked me through all the ways that I could increase my overall grade. He has even talked through the night w/ me discussing homework assignments. I have never had any TA that does the things Jordan does.
Never had a problem. Got an A+. Pretty easy stuff and he always helps you if there is a hard thing you have to do.
I don't have any complaints other than I was hoping my grade would be bumped up a tiny bit from a b- to a B. But that didn't happen.
Everything went smoothly and you could tell he tried to make things as least stressful as possible for us.
Just overall a really nice experience as a class and as a prof

This guy is probably one of the best TAs Ive seen. Like honestly, he spent the whole day this week just to answer one question I had. He put off his own homework. I was like wow man you dont have to do that, but he wanted to. caring as hell.
didnt seem to care about individual students. cared more about just getting his job done
This guy isnt going to let you fail if you tried. Constantly reaching out about my wellbeing, what he can do to help and advising me on assignments.
Would 100% take this class again just to have him as my ta. So funny, caring and understanding.

I had him as a ta in my entomology classs and he responds quickly, obviously cares about us, and grades fairly. He even lets you fix things when you upload your homework before he "officially" takes a look at it to grade.
I like how fast he responds to my emails. He's not the professor of the course, but the TA. I would recommend this course if he's a TA again.
he's just a TA but great dude.
Great guy and one thing I really liked is that he always provided good feedback on our assignments. His heart is definitely in it. It was for an entomology course in the Dept. of Ag. at OSU.

Is not good at teaching the subject.
Cannot answer questions on the subject, answer would pretty much be look back at the slides and figure it out yourself.
Asks open questions but expects one specific answer even thought their are several right answers
Take the 2260 data analysis from any other professor.
Worst professor I've ever had, stay far away.

Complete neglect of students. Interesting lectures, but your grade is based on two exams and one quiz that she grades hard. She nitpicks exam responses and makes everything more complicated than it needs to be. She does not care about her students at all, and the low exam averages are representative of this. Worst professor I've ever had.

Professor bello is by no means a horrible professor but if given the chance to take this class again, I would not take it with her. Only being graded off of 1 quiz and 2 exams the entire semester is atrocious. There is no extra credit opportunities and the grading is quite harsh.

Don't take it, especially when she changed the course to 6 weeks in the summer. She will spend more than 3 weeks grading your assignment, so your paper can never be improved based on the grade or feedback (because when you hand in the next paper, she still hasn't given any feedback or grade on the last paper)

I took this class as a 6-week online class and the volume of work was wildly inconsistent. She also is a very slow grader and will grade stuff weeks after they are done even in such a condensed class. The final paper is a very rigid format and doesn't allow for free writing, which is horrible. Not a class I would recommend in this format.

First and foremost, this is a very easy class to get an A. With that being said, this class is extremely confused, classes are never consistent, papers are graded harshly with no feedback (I am a solid writer [A- range] and I'm always getting low B's in this class). You can get away with just reading the slides and be A-okay in the reflections/exam

Pretty easy class, you do not need the book, don't even read it and its free online. Quizzes are based on the lectures so I would half-pay attention. The paper is nice because you can choose something that interests you and that made it pretty easy to write. She gives a clear outline too which is nice. Attend recitation for participation points.

Dr. George was such an amazing professor. She made the lectures interesting and was very passionate in what she taught. The assignments throughout the semester are very light and she gives you enough time to work on your paper, with spread-out due dates for small portions of the essay. Would recommend, especially if you need a 2367 course for a GE.
Dr George is so nice! She's super passionate and very knowledgable about what she teaches. As long as you attend class and keep up to date on your assignments, you'll be fine!

I took this class as an online 6 week summer class so my experience might be different than yours, but the class was fine it wasn't my favorite, but she graded pretty easily. I thought all of my essays were bad when I turned them in but always got 90s or 100s on them. The lectures are long and can be boring. This is a good writing gen ed course tho

1 Recitation and 2 Lectures per week. Recitation is mandatory, but then the lectures are optional because she uses zoom for it since it is on Ag Campus. Everything is pretty easy. Mostly busy work and writing but it's easy. There's a 6-9 page paper due at the end, but you work on it the entire semester. Small parts due at a time. Fun class

Honestly, the worst professor I've had at OSU (and I've taken several Chemistry courses). 99% of the time I don't think she knows what she's talking about. There's a 16 person group project with a 15 min presentation and 20 min activity which is extremely difficult to split up the work . Worst class, worst professor. PICK A DIFFERENT CLASS.

Its a hybrid class so you only go in once a week, the rest of the lectures are live streamed and fridays lectures are pre recorded so there is never class fridays. You basically only write one paper the whole year, super easy definitely take this as your 2nd year english.

Overall a very solid second year writing course that is very top heavy with work at the beginning which tails off towards the end as you work on your research paper. Decent amount of 1-2 page reflections, two 3 page module reflections, one group project, three quizzes and a final paper. The book is useless. Easy 2367 even for non-AniSci majors.

You only have to show up to one class out of three for the week - the recitation (where she takes attendance). The two lectures she lets you have the option of watching/listening to class on your computer, so technically you don't have to be there. No final other than just turning in your research paper.

I feel singled out sometimes in class because she memorizes your name and then calls on you out of the blue. Assigns super long readings that you have to discuss in class. Gives a broad topic for group project with no directions on what she wants for it & she expects you to present it for the entire length of the class period

She is super nice, and for a writing course this is actually kind of interesting. They try to scare you that this class won't be an easy A, it is. She grades super easily, just follow the rubric. The class is one big paper that is also your final, and some other small assignments. Have to go to recitation but lectures are recorded. Would recommend.
Easy class, just pay attention to lectures and quizzes are simple. The papers are graded really easily too.
Easy 2367 class even if you aren't an animal sciences major. Would recommend her class.
I felt Dr. Parker was amazing and a very genuine teacher. Her lectures and classes were very straightforward and easy to follow
I really loved her class and felt that she was a very genuine teacher. Classwork was pretty easy and very straightforward

Probably one of the most interesting classes I've taken; attendance is graded, but she does this to make sure everyone can succeed in the class. Coming to lecture is really helpful and she's great at going in depth on each slide. It's only offered at 8am so get ready to be up early, but the class was great and we learned super cool stuff.

Dr. Parker is by far one of my favorite professors Ive ever had. She makes the concepts easy to learn and gets many of her exam questions from class discussions and quizzes. She truly wants you to excel in her class.

Dr. Parker was amazing! She is willing to answer any questions you have and not look at you like you're dumb. She is very passionate about animal health and you can tell. I can't wait to take more classes with her.

Liz is a really nice professor who always cracks jokes in class, so she's fun to listen too. You do weekly quizzes, 2 exams, and a short essay-paper. She was really nice and very fair. I would definitely take another class with her. Her lectures are very dense, but it's a half semester class so not really her fault.

Dr. Parker was very nice and animal handling was super fun! He talks a lot so lectures can drag on at times, but the labs are super great and he has a lot of knowledge. He is always willing to chat and answer questions. The assignments consist of weekly quizzes based on the lecture slides and a few questions about the lab each week.

Only 3 grades all semesters (the 3 exams). And if you mess up the first one forget it. They are basically the same as the practice exams which helps, but not if you find out too late. He was brought to OSU to do research and it shows. Would be great for nutrition 5000, but is awful for nutrition 101

I loved Dr. Parker! Nutrition is a difficult subject and I for one am very thankful I had him rather than the other instructor. He was extremely helpful whenever questions were asked and always willing to go over things again in class. The final was extremely stressful studying for since it was comprehensive, but ended up being extremely easy!

Final exam was 55% of the final grade, only other grades were a few quizzes and a midterm. I thought TP was a good professor, but a final exam worth that much is way too much pressure to put on students, even when able to prepare for it. Would rate higher if not for that; good professor, makes material understandable but a tough class.

55% of the overall grade was based on the final, 25% the midterm, and 20% graded quizzes. He clearly has no interest in teaching or making the material understandable. Nutrition is a difficult subject, but it all builds off of each other. He never made these connections, rather presented each topic as a separate entity. AWFUL class due to the prof

This professor contradicted himself daily, was not available outside of class for help, and tested on material he didn't teach. He tells you not to buy the book then at the end of the semester recommends you use it to study for the final. He also makes the majority of the semester open note, but don't let that fool you because his tests are hard.

He doesn't care at all about teaching. You can barely hear him and he mumbles all of the time.  I learned so much more by reading his lecture slides later. Our final was 55% of our total grade and he changed the format at least three times before he finally decided how he wanted to do it. Worst professor I have ever had. Period.

Dr. Moeller is super nice and very experienced. He can be a bit intimidating because he asks a lot of questions and expects an answer, but it will help you in the long run. His exam questions are slightly over specific so it can be difficult, but his lab is super enjoyable and he never makes you do something if you are uncomfortable.

Moeller is definitely a very experienced and intelligent person, but he isn't the best at teaching to people who are learning about the industry for the first time. He asks questions that are really specific to his line of work and not many people know the answers. Exams are pretty tough, even when they were open note online.

Dr Moeller gives out random free extra credit when you attend class. Youll learn how to handle different livestock animals and have discussions and open book quizzes every week. Final exam has about 30 questions and as long as you are present for lab, its an easy A. Definitely the most enjoyable animal science class!

Dr. Moeller is very knowledgeable on a variety of topics. I have had him in a few classes, and he seemed scary at first, but now I know that he is just straight-forward and to the point. He does enjoy a lot of discussion, which really makes you think, and wants his students to do well.

Dr. Moeller is an awesome guy, willing to help you. But I don't necessarily like the way he teaches. He needs to understand that he is not just teaching to students who know about the industry. There are students who take the class b/c they do not know ANYTHING about the industry and want to learn, but can't learn b/c of his open ended questions.
One of the few professors that let's you think for yourself.  Very good!

steve is not a very nice person. He will be nice at first but if you call him out, he will be mean to you the entire quarter. He hates people who are late to class or don't listen to every word he says (like he's the messiah or something). Choose ana hill over him, she's soooo nice and makes class a lot more fun and easier!
Very easy going guy just do what he asks and participate in class and you will be fine.

He really wants his students to do well and will do everything he can to help! Really great teacher. He is not scary, he got upset at one student who was being disrespectful. Go to class, the review sessions, and ask questions, you'll do fine. Overall a very nice guy and good teacher!

Excellent teacher.  One of the best in the animal science department.  Come to class and pay attention and you should get a good grade.  Also, he really isn't scary, as many of the comments on here suggest.  Be respectful (which you should be anyways) and you'll be fine.

difficult class, must attend lecture or go over material w/him for missed classes. Intelligent. Wont waste his time on you if you don't care about his class. Not mean or scary. If you respect him he will respect you.

Hes a good teacher. VERY knowledgeable. Can be difficult if you do not spend time on the class. Does complain, but we all do. He can be scary at times, but if you go and talk to him in his office, he is really nice and will explain it to you. If you do the work, pay attention, and ask question, you will do fine.

He's super scary. :( He also gets really mean about things and spends a large portion of class complaining about people being late and pondering their punishment. If he would just take it easy and back off a bit he'd be a good teacher. He seems intelligent but a little too uptight.

Horrible professor. Very unapproachable, mean and scary almost. Class is uninteresting. Instead of testing knowledge he emphasizes rote memorization. Overall a very bad and disappointing experience, his class is one of the reasons I'm switching my major.

Final grade is 90% exams & 10% quizzes. Exams are 50 questions & you get 40 minutes to complete them. Quizzes are worth 100 points each, 5 questions & you only get 4 minutes to take them. He lectures 3 days a week for an hour & expects you to remember EVERY SINGLE WORD he says. His exams are extremely difficult. Hes very smart but bad at teaching

Anyone who is an ANIMSCI major has to take this at one point, so be prepared. The material is super interesting but very dense, and Pope's lecture slides aren't the greatest. Write down EVERYTHING he says! Overall, he is a fine teacher but during COVID has been difficult to reach at times. Try and enjoy the material and just get through it!

Not a quality professor. Does not have office hours so the only way to reach him is email, but he doesn't answer emails, expects students to memorize hundreds of slides of material and quizzes you on seemingly unimportant information from massive slide shows.

I have never left a review on here before but I have to for this professor. Pope is the WORST professor I have ever had. No assignments besides 8 quizzes(5 counted towards your grade) and 3 exams, which are extremely difficult and worded poorly. He doesn't reply to emails at all and does not cooperate with the students. I had to drop it.

Dr. Pope is a super knowledgeable professor and he definitely puts your skills to the test. He talks kind of fast about the topic so make sure you are prepared to write your notes and listen closely. He is a super kind gentleman and really cares about his students but this pandemic was super rough on all of us. Overall, a hard class but fun topic.

I never leave reviews but I'm leaving this because pope is legit the worst professor I've ever had. I'm a straight A student but did awful in this class because his exams are ridiculously unfair. He asks questions about things he never discussed. Your grade is 90% exams and 10% quizzes. You get less time on exams than the number of questions on it

He is an extremely fair professor and genuinely wants his students to succeed. Attendance is not mandatory, but make sure you go to each lecture, take good notes, and be prepared for TopHat quizzes. He will only test you on lecture content, but reading the book can prepare you for extra credit questions. He only ever teaches at 8am so be prepared.

Dr. Pope has good intentions, but is simply not a good teacher. I have already taken a physiology class for credit, but wanted to take his class to simply learn more about animal phys because my class class was based on humans. He is NOT organized at all. He knows the information but does not communicate it in a manner that you can understand.

I found this course to be extremely difficult. He was the type of professor who is almost too smart because he speaks a different language. You MUST go to class. I studied at least 5 hours for every exam and still did poorly. He curves the class a lot though. I took Animal Science 3160 which is reproductive physiology and I loved it.
Great professor, everything on the tests is said in lecture but not all on PowerPoint slides so make sure you go to class and take good notes.

Dr. Pope is an okay professor. You have to go to lecture, as there is attendance and most of his slides are jus pictures or diagrams. He jumps around a lot and can easily get behind. Exams were alright if you go to class and write everything he says, and read the textbook. Each exam has some extra credit questions that usually come from the book.

Pope was a real gem to have in class. 8ams suck, but he made them worth it. He does do TopHat pop quizzes, and those are rough so always be ready for them!! His extra credit questions will hurt you if you miss them though, so be cautious when doing those on exams. This class will benefit you in every science class you take after.
